repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body: Inherited from #6073 , this PR expand the utilization of C functions for divmod() to C long type by calling the C ldiv() function.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    >>> divmod_regular(4399, 2048)
    (2, 303)
    >>> divmod_regular(88321773, 98539211)
    (0, 88321773)
```
And the same in all other places. There is no need to disregard PEP-8 in doctests.

Alternatively, we could move the `(b == 0)` test first, add `(a == 0) => (0, 0)` and change this condition to `((a > 0) != (b > 0))`. Not sure which is better. As long as we return a Python tuple, you won't be able to measure a performance difference, but the intent seems slightly clearer in a less verbose condition to me (and maybe just me).

In any case, I'd move the zero division error check first, just to be on the safe side for the rest of the code. Mark it as a clear error case with `(unlikely(b == 0))` to make sure the C compiler optimises around it.

Since the code is practically the same as above, except for the types, I think we can use Tempita template generation to avoid the duplication. Look for `TempitaUtilityCode`. You can then easy add `long long` as well.

I will have a look on the Tempita template later.
Before submitting this PR, I was more hesitate on how to declare `long long` in the `Cython/Compiler/Builtin.py` file.
See `abs` for an example of `long long`. It's unfortunately a bit more verbose.
Finally managed to review back this PR before the new year. I have just submitted a commit to address this. Thanks and happy new year!
Finally managed to review back this PR before the new year. I have just submitted a commit to rearrange the conditions. Thanks and happy new year!

`b == 0` was probably tested last because it's an exceptional case, to make sure that we jump in the fast path immediately. Can't say how important `a == 0` is. Probably not something to invest time on in the normal case.
OTOH, your ordering seems perfectly reasonable and fast to me. I'm fine with it.

commit.message: Accelerate divmod() by calling C ldiv() for C long type integers.
Rearrange the arithmetic logic of the divmod function and improve the file format.
